subject: Real Estate
title: Narrative Economics in Real Estate
description: A micro-lesson that makes Narrative Economics in Real Estate usable.

hook.text: 'House prices never go down.' This single story, repeated endlessly, inflated the 2008 bubble.

buildup.text: Nobel laureate Robert Shiller studied how narratives spread like viruses and drive economic behavior.

discovery.text: Stories are more persuasive than data. A neighbor's success story outweighs a hundred charts.

twist.text: After a crash, the narrative flips: 'Real estate is a terrible investment.' Both stories are equally wrong.

climax.text: Markets aren't moved by numbers alone. They're moved by the stories people tell each other.

punchline.text: A good story moves markets more than good data.

quiz.question: What did Robert Shiller study about markets?
options: How narratives spread and drive economic behavior
